Thanks for the reply. I also found the Ant issue after a quick google. 

I =
guess I was more interested on how Ant is extracting the information
out of=
 JUnit. I was hoping to avoid creating my own runner/formatter
to directly =
run and monitor the JUnit executions (just to get this
info). Is there any =
way, short of that, to get JUnit to "report" which
tests were ignored and w=
hy?

FYI, I've built a small utility class that grovels over the test
class=
es/methods looking for "@Ignore" annotations and spits out the
desired info=
 already. It just seems like this functionality should be
built-in already.=


Bob
